intro: Jacquemontia ovalifolia subsp. obcordata, commonly known as the obcordate jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and bindweeds. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
